usefulItems: rolling pin, muslin cloth, large bowl, cling film, baking tray and baking paper, baking paper and baking beans, tart tins (Ø 10 cm), refrigerator, oven
title: Caramelised Fennel and Ricotta Tarts with Pecorino Crisps

ingredients.content: 100 g unsalted butter, cold, diced (1 cm)
200 g fennel, core removed, quartered, fronds reserved for garnish
20 g butter, plus extra for greasing
30 - 40 g Swiss chard, stalks removed, thinly sliced
½ tsp fine sea salt, or to taste
½ tsp ground black pepper, or to taste
100 g pecorino cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Preparation
Ricotta
Place milk in mixing bowl and warm <b>10 min/80°C/speed 2<b>.
Add vinegar and heat <b>1 min/90°C/speed 1<b>. Allow to sit for 1 minute - the milk will separate into curds and whey.

Line simmering basket with two layers of muslin cloth and set over a large bowl. Pour mixture into simmering basket and allow to drain for at least 1 hour. Transfer drained ricotta (approx. 170 g) to a bowl, stir through lemon zest then rest in fridge.
Shortcrust Pastry
Place flour, butter and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add water and knead <b>10-20 sec/<b>, until mixture comes together.
Tip out and form into a ball. Wrap in cling film and place in fridge to rest for 15 minutes.
Filling
Preheat oven to 180°C and grease 8 fluted tart tins (Ø 10 cm).
Place fennel in mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add butter, vinegar and sugar then cook <b>12 min/120°C/speed 1<b>. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in Swiss chard then steam <b>2 min 30 sec/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Transfer Swiss chard to a bowl and set aside.

Using a rolling pin, roll out pastry and use to line prepared tart tins. Line with baking paper and fill with baking beans then blind bake for approx. 15 minutes (180°C) or until pastry cases are golden. Spread fennel mixture on base of each pastry case, then add olives (if using).

Place remaining filling ingredients, reserved Swiss chard and reserved ricotta in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec//speed 3<b>. Spoon mixture evenly over each tart and bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C) or until just set. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make crisps.
Pecorino Crisps
Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place fennel seeds in mixing bowl and toast <b>2 min/120°C/speed 1<b>. Allow to cool in mixing bowl (approx. 10 minutes).
Add pecorino and grate <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>.
Spread mixture thinly over prepared baking tray. Bake for 7-10 minutes (180°C) until golden and bubbling. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before roughly breaking into crisps.
Serve tarts warm, garnished with fennel fronds and pecorino crisps.
